intro: Hieracium pyrrhophorum, commonly known as the red hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its bright yellow flowers are surrounded by reddish bracts, giving it a striking appearance. Hieracium pyrrhophorum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in many temperate regions.
